lead_paragraph: The plan, brokered by Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, would include accelerated prospects for Turkey to join the European Union.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin.

headline.print_headline: E.U. Seeks Revised Plan to Curb Flow of Refugees
headline.main: E.U. Aims to Revise Proposed Migrants Deal With Turkey

snippet: The plan, brokered by Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, would include accelerated prospects for Turkey to join the European Union.
abstract: European Union authorities attempt to amend terms of provisional agreement with Turkey, originally brokered by German Chancellor Angela Merkel, which seeks to reduce influx of migrants and refugees entering Europe through Turkey.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
